claims.involves: Robert Moore, a retired university dean who lives in San Jose, California
claims.background: To celebrate his 100th birthday, his family invited neighbours to line up with their dogs outside a family home.
claims.claim: Over 200 dogs showed up and lined up around the block to wish Robert a happy birthday.

clues.0: Robert Moore is a dog lover.
clues.1:
The dogs wore their birthday best —
tuxedos and mini cowboy hats — and came with cards, flowers, cupcakes and, of course, doggy kisses.
clues.2: A Facebook reel with photos and videos of Moore’s big day got over 440,000 likes and 90,000 shares
clues.3: His family posted on the neighbourhood app Nextdoor and Facebook, asking dog owners to stop by with their canines for a pet parade.
clues.4: Moore’s daughter Alison Moore, told The Washington Post that her father has loved dogs all his life and wants to pet each one he sees.

true.0:
Being a dog lover doesn't mean there were 200 dogs at the birthday party!

It's essential to check for more evidence to confirm the claim's accuracy.
true.1: Nice outfits, but the clue didn’t tell us about the birthday party or if there were 200 dogs!
true.2:
The reel and tweet said he had 200 dogs for his birthday. BUT the number of likes and shares on a reel does not necessarily indicate whether the information in the reel is true!

Tip: Keep investigating till you get more reliable information.
true.3: A neighbourhood app post by his family sounds credible but only tells us that they invited dog owners for a pet parade!
true.4: The article mentions that more than 200 dogs showed up for the birthday celebration! Based on this evidence from The Washington Post, the claim that over 200 dogs attended the party is considered 'Good enough to be true.'

false.0: The clue didn’t tell us about the birthday party nor if there were 200 dogs to verify the claim!
false.1: Nice outfits, but the clue didn’t tell us about the birthday party or if there were 200 dogs!
false.2:
Although the number of likes and shares on a reel does not necessarily indicate whether the information in the reel is true, the reel and tweet said he had 200 dogs for his birthday!

Tip: Keep investigating till you get more reliable information.
false.3:
The neighbourhood app post by his family sounds credible but only tells us that they invited dog owners for a pet parade!

Keep investigating till you get relevant information!
false.4: The article mentions that more than 200 dogs showed up for the birthday celebration! Based on this evidence from The Washington Post, the claim that over 200 dogs attended the party is considered 'Good enough to be true.'

claims.background: In June 2023, protests erupted across France following the fatal police shooting of a teen.
claims.claim: Protestors released animals out of the zoo.

clues.0: A video montage of zebras, lions, wolves, ostriches, and elephants roaming free in neighbourhoods and streets was posted on Instagram.
clues.1: One video, which has over 1.8 million views on Twitter alone, has been shared by an account called Insane Reality Leaks. The account has a blue “verified” check mark.
clues.2: Most videos shared on social media consist of a number of poor-quality clips apparently recorded using a mobile phone.
clues.3: There have been a lot of fakes during these riots, including videos showing a fake sniper, a crowd in Mexico City and a stolen police van that’s actually from a Netflix movie.

true.0:
Many of the video clips are old or from different places, inside and outside of France.

The Paris Zoological Park also resonded on Twitter, reassuring that all the animals are safe.
true.1:
The Paris Zoological Park also resonded on Twitter, reassuring that all the animals are safe.

Many of the video clips are old or from different places, inside and outside of France.

Since Twitter stopped user verification after Elon Musk's purchase in October 2022, the presence of a ‘verified’ check mark on an account no longer guarantees the credibility of the content.
true.2:
The Paris Zoological Park also resonded on Twitter, reassuring that all the animals are safe.

Many of the video clips are old or from different places, inside and outside of France.

Since Twitter stopped user verification after Elon Musk's purchase in October 2022, the presence of a ‘verified’ check mark on an account no longer guarantees the credibility of the content.
true.3:
Although video quality, recorded devices and other fake videos don’t support or refute the claim, many “animal release” videos are old or from different places, inside and outside of France.

The Paris Zoological Park also resonded on Twitter, reassuring that all the animals are safe.

false.0:
Many of the video clips are old or from different places, inside and outside of France.

The Paris Zoological Park also resonded on Twitter, reassuring that all the animals are safe.
false.1: Since Twitter stopped user verification after Elon Musk's purchase in October 2022, the presence of a ‘verified’ check mark on an account no longer guarantees the credibility of the content.
false.2:
Video quality and recorded device doesn’t provide evidence either supporting or refuting the claim.

Look for more relevant information!
false.3: The mentioned “lot of fakes during these riots” does not talk about released zoo animals!

claims.involves: Davyon Johnson, a sixth grader from Muskogee, Oklahoma
claims.background: From having a normal school day, he went on to be named an honorary police officer.
claims.claim: A 11-year-old boy saved the lives of 2 people on the same day.

clues.0: The Enid News & Eagle, a northwest Oklahoma newspaper, reported that Davyon put to use what he had learned from a YouTube video.
clues.1: An Instagram post in April 2023 said that “He saw a friend choking at school and performed the Heimlich maneuver. Then on his way home, he saw a house fire and pulled a woman to safety.”
clues.2: Davyon told his story in a 2023 video for the American Red Cross — said he was in his life skills class at the time of the incident.
clues.4: The New York Times reported that his mother stopped and called the police while Davyon went to knock on the door to warn the people inside.

true.0: BUT what did he learn and use, and for what? The fact that he learned something from a YouTube video doesn't prove the claim!
true.1: The post talks about the two separate instances where Davyon intervened to save lives. The fact it includes both scenarios provides supporting evidence for the claim that he saved two lives on the same day.
true.2:
Muskogee Public Schools recognized his actions during a school board meeting and gave him the heroism award.

He also received honorary membership in the local police and sheriff’s departments.
true.3: In 2021, news outlets like CNN, The New York Times and Enid News & Eagle reported that the then-sixth grader from Muskogee, Oklahoma, saved the lives of two people in one day.
true.4: Yes, an older woman using a walker had trouble moving quickly enough, so Davyon helped her get away from the house and move toward her truck.

false.0: This clue did not give any information that specifically contradicts the claim about him saving two lives in one day!
false.1: The fact that the post includes both scenarios provides supporting evidence for the claim that he saved two lives on the same day. The absence of additional sources and evidence doesn't automatically make the claim false.
false.2:
Muskogee Public Schools recognized his actions during a school board meeting and gave him the heroism award.

He also received honorary membership in the local police and sheriff’s departments.
false.3: The authenticity of the claim is supported by media coverage, including CNN, The New York Times, and Enid News & Eagle, which confirmed the event.

claims.involves: American professional basketball player LeBron James
claims.claim: LeBron James dressed in pink for the “Barbie” movie

clues.0: ButtCrackSports tweeted that LeBron James said '10/10 … a must-watch film' about the Barbie film.
clues.1: The photo had uneven wrinkling in James’ face, the poorly formed logo on his T-shirt, his oddly shaped fingernails.
clues.2: A Facebook post which claimed 'LeBron is ready to watch ‘Barbie' was flagged as Altered/Misleading.

true.0:
The claim came from a Twitter parody account with a profile that says, 'Nothing Tweeted Should Be Taken As Fact.'

Politifact says that the photo used in it is altered as well.
true.1: AI experts pointed to these details to signal the pink skirt James photo was generated by AI.
true.2: Meta works with independent fact-checkers who are certified through the non-partisan International Fact-Checking Network to help identify and review false information to combat false news and misinformation on its News Feed.

false.0:
The claim came from a Twitter parody account with a profile that says, 'Nothing Tweeted Should Be Taken As Fact.'

Politifact says that the photo used in it is altered as well.
false.1: AI experts pointed to these details to signal the pink skirt James photo was generated by AI.
false.2: Meta works with independent fact-checkers who are certified through the non-partisan International Fact-Checking Network to help identify and review false information to combat false news and misinformation on its News Feed.

claims.background: Wisconsin is known as the dairy state, with farms dotting the countryside but the sand and peat marshes in central and northern Wisconsin create the perfect growing conditions for cranberries.
claims.claim: Wisconsin is the top cranberry producer in the United States

clues.0: Cranberries are Wisconsin’s official state fruit.
clues.1: Wisconsin’s cranberry produce is more than twice that of Massachusetts in 2021.
clues.2: Cranberries are Wisconsin’s important economic driver, employing nearly 4,000 people in Wisconsin and their marshes covering 21,000 acres of Wisconsin’s land.
clues.3: University of Wisconsin-Madison said that Wisconsin grew nearly 60% of the Cranberries.

true.1: BUT what does the clue say about Cranberry being the top producer?
true.2: BUT what does the clue say about Cranberry being the top producer?
true.0: BUT what does the clue say about Cranberry being the top producer?
true.3: U.S. Department of Agriculture, National Agriculture Statistics Service, Wisconsin Ag News – Cranberries, in May 2022, said that Wisconsin maintained its number one ranking in total cranberry production with 59 percent of the nation's total.

false.0:
This information doesn’t say anything about whether cranberries are the top producers or not!

How did you know that the claim was False?
